text: Ryutosan Shrine was Shinto Shrine in Gwangju during the Japanese occupation of Korea. The enshrined deities were Amaterasu Omikami and Kunitama Omikami . Japan's defeat in World War II led to the shrine's abolition on November 17, 1945.内務省告示第264号 官報第5660号（昭和20年11月22日） 1頁 Chureito Pagoda stands where Gwangju Shrine used to be. == Gallery == File:광주신사본전배전제기고신찬소전경.png|alt=前景|front File:광주신사_신문과_양익사_내관.png|alt=内観|middle File:광주신사_신전배면.png|alt=背面|back ==References== Category:Kokuhei Shōsha Category:Pages with unreviewed translations Category:Shinto shrines in the Japanese colonial empire Category:Shinmei shrines
title: Kōshū Shrine
